required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Natural History of Asymptomatic Superior Mesenteric Arterial Stenosis.
clinical_study.official_title: Natural History of Asymptomatic Superior Mesenteric Arterial Stenosis Depends on Celiac and Inferior Mesenteric Arteries Status.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate asymptomatic superior mesenteric artery (SMA) stenosis prognosis according to the presence of coeliac artery (CA) and/or inferior mesenteric artery (IMA) associated stenosis.

detailed_description.textblock: BACKGROUND: The benefit of preventive treatment for SMA stenosis remains uncertain. The latest guidelines remain unclear given the lack of data in the literature.

primary_outcome.measure: Development of mesenteric disease defined as acute mesenteric ischemia or chronic mesenteric ischemia.

arm_group.description: patient with isolated SMA stenosis on initial scanner

arm_group.arm_group_label: patient with both SMA stenosis and CA or/and IMA stenosis
arm_group.description: patient with both SMA stenosis and CA or/and IMA stenosis on initial scanner

intervention.arm_group_label: patient with both SMA stenosis and CA or/and IMA stenosis

study_pop.textblock:
- patients with isolated >70% SMA stenosis
- patients with both SMA stenosis and CA or/and IMA >70% stenosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- the presence of coeliac artery (CA) and/or inferior mesenteric artery (IMA) associated stenosis.
Exclusion Criteria:
-
